body: A goblin who controls the sky commands the respect of the tribe, due to her ability to drop beehives, bombs, and other unpleasant items onto enemies.
name: Goblin Vulture Pilot

sections.ac: 21, touch 15, flat-footed 17 (+4 armor, +4 Dex, +2 natural, +1 size)
sections.special_attacks: bomb 7/day (2d6+3 fire and catch fire, DC 15, 10-ft. radius)
sections.other_gear: mwk mithral chain shirt, dagger, sunrods (2), 293 gp

spells.alchemist extracts prepared:
(CL 4th)

2nd-false life, touch injection

1st-bomber's eye, bouncy body *, shield, true strike

sections.feats: Brew Potion, Mounted Archery, Mounted Combat, Throw Anything

sections.body:
Before Combat The vulture pilot drinks a bouncy body extract, a false life extract, and a potion of barkskin, then feeds a potion of barkskin to her vulture companion.

During Combat The pilot uses her bombs to scatter opponents on the ground, tanglefoot bags to hold tasty prizes in place, and alchemical splash weapons as the situation warrants.

Base Statistics Without barkskin and false life, the vulture pilot's statistics are

AC 19, touch 15, flat-footed 15

hp 29.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.special_qualities: alchemy (alchemy crafting +4, identify potions), discoveries (explosive bomb, sipping pet*), poison use, swift alchemy
sections.name: Goblin Vulture Pilot
sections.skills: Acrobatics +8, Climb +3, Craft (alchemy) +10, Handle Animal +2, Perception +8, Ride +12, Stealth +16
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Goblins/Example Goblins/Goblin Vulture Pilot/Goblin Vulture Pilot
sections.combat_gear: potions of barkskin (2), potions of cure light wounds (2), acid (2), alchemist's fire (2), tanglefoot bags (2)

sections.body:
Base Statistics Without barkskin, the giant vulture's statistics are

AC 17, touch 13, flat-footed 14.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: Strapped to her giant vulture companion, the goblin vulture pilot is a peerless scout and saboteur. Enemies find goblin vulture pilots tough to pin down as they lob explosive bombs from the air. Vulture pilots are braver, more disciplined, and more patient than most goblins, as they have to sneak into giant vulture nests to steal eggs, resist the temptation to eat those eggs, and raise the hatchlings to be loyal mounts. Many pilots die in flying accidents; the lucky ones often discover how to craft extracts of bouncy body, levitate, or similar effects to help them survive the inevitable crashes.
Goblin vulture pilots take great pride in their abilities, and often wear their mounts' feathers as headdresses or paint themselves with guano as marks of status.

sections.special_qualities: tricks (attack, come, defend, down, guard, stay)
sections.name: Giant Vulture
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Goblins/Example Goblins/Goblin Vulture Pilot/Giant Vulture
